definition: to rule/to govern/to manage/to control/to harness (a river)/to treat (a disease)/to wipe out (a pest)/to punish/to research
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Analysis of the Non-linear Relationship between Sci-tech Progress and Social Development;
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，非政治性的勢力也在發展之中。

sentences.english: Many of the obstacles facing the Doha negotiations are political.
sentences.chinese: 多哈談判面臨的許多障礙都是政治性的。

sentences.english: Some pacifistsand all militarists deprecate social and political conflicts.
sentences.chinese: 和一切軍國主義者都反對社會性和政治性的鬥爭。

sentences.english: The Club is entirely voluntarily run and is non political.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部是一個全部自願管理的非政治性組織。

sentences.english: But music is more political than other acts in some ways.
sentences.chinese: 但在某些方面，音樂比其他任何藝術都更具政治性。

sentences.english: They seem to work, some of the time, for political best-seller-writers, too.
sentences.chinese: 他們似乎有時也會從事寫作，發表政治性暢銷書籍。

sentences.english: The economic effect of the assistance was not satisfactory, and its goal was political.
sentences.chinese: 但美援的經濟效果不佳，政治性是其主要目的。

sentences.english: Fabian says he did not set out to make Skin overtly political.
sentences.chinese: 法比安說，他並沒有完全把《膚色》作政治性詮釋。

sentences.english: Yet the investment is, by its very nature, political.
sentences.chinese: 然而這項投資本質上就是政治性的。

sentences.english: There were no reports of political prisoners or detainees.
sentences.chinese: 沒有政治性犯人和在押人員的報道。

sentences.english: He isn't saying that man is political by nature.
sentences.chinese: 他其實並未說人類天生具有政治性。

sentences.english: In a sense, the statement of the contemporary historiography is a kind of pure political discourse.
sentences.chinese: 在某種意義上，當代史言說是一種純粹的政治性話語。

sentences.english: And then there is this very political response.
sentences.chinese: 接着就有了這樣，政治性的應答。

sentences.english: It is speech that makes us political.
sentences.chinese: 是因爲辯論的能力讓我們具有政治性。

sentences.english: It is a reason or speech, not instinct, that makes us political.
sentences.chinese: 是理法或辯論能力而非本能，使我們具有政治性。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, ideology possesses non-political nature as well.
sentences.chinese: 同時，意識形態又有非政治性。

definition: to do with the masses/mass (meeting, movement etc)
